Main pronunciation 主要发音: duǒ

Original meaning 本义: Meaning a pile of.

English senses 英语理解: heap, pile; pile up, heap up

Usage example 用法举例: 垛草 duǒ cǎo (pile up hay)

垜字的基本解释

垜
duǒ
同“垛”。

垜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［duǒ］
［《廣韻》徒果切，上果，定。］
亦作“垜1”。
(1)墙或某些建筑物的突出部位。
(2)箭靶。
(3)用泥糊或塑造。
[②]［duò］
亦作“垜2”。
(1)堆积。
(2)整齐地堆积成的堆。
(3)明代兵制名。明初定垛兵法，把军户三家编为一垛，其中一户为正，二户为贴。按三丁抽一以应军役。正户兵死，则由贴户抽丁补充。永乐初，改正户、贴户轮次更代，周而复始。
(4)量词。

垜字的康熙字典解释

【丑集中】【土字部】　垜； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页228第09
【字彙】同垛。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［duǒ］
["Guangyun" cut the fruit, set the fruit, set it. ]
Also known as "垜1".
(1) The protruding parts of walls or certain buildings.
(2) Archery target.
(3) Use mud or shape.
[②]［duò］
Also known as "垜2".
(1) Accumulation.
(2) Neatly stacked piles.
(3) The name of the military system in the Ming Dynasty. At the beginning of the Ming Dynasty, the art of war was determined, and the three military households were grouped into one pile, one of which was a positive and the other was a sticker. Draw one by three for military service. The death of a soldier in the household will be supplemented by the post household. At the beginning of Yongle, the renewal of corrections and postings were repeated.
(4) Quantifiers.
